column3: CIL-Civil Lot, DRL- Drainage Lot, EAL- Earthworks Lot, ELL- Electrical Lot, UTL- Utility Lot, STL- Structural Lot
EB - Eastbound, ME - Median, NB - Northbound, SB - Southbound, WB - Westbound

column2: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure this mix design has been registered and is approved by Superintendent prior to laying mix.
Inspection / Test Method: Correspondence of receipt of mix design
Record of Conformity: VR approval Completed ITP
Responsibility: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
Acceptance Criteria: All quality information received for lot (includes levels, area and volume) and NCRs (BIRs) approved.
Reference Documents: Relevant ITP for underlying lot
Record of Conformity: Inspection and Test Plan

Acceptance Criteria: If the execution of any part of the work under the Subcontract is dependent upon the quality and completeness of an existing surface or work performed by Separate Contractors, the subcontractors shall visually inspect the existing surface or Separate Contractor's work for matters including the following:
(v) Free from loose and foreign materials

and immediately notify the Contractors Representative of all matters discovered that a competent contractor who specialises in the type of works performed under Subcontract should have discussed by such inspection which in the Subcontractor's opinion render such work unsuitable for the proper execution of the work under the Subcontract.
Reference Documents: CTW-175S Special Condition 11 (Refer Downer ITP - 1145-C200-FUL-QAC-CHK-0001)
Record of Conformity: Inspection and Test Plan ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: The majority of the surface area to be paved has a temperature greater than or equal to the following:
Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or
Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs
Acceptance Criteria: Runs to be marked to ensure placement of joints satisfy the following unless otherwise approved by the Client (MRPV):
(i) Transverse Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 2m
(ii) Longitudinal Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. V
(iii) Wearing course shall be on lane lines.
Inspection / Test Method: Measure and mark out runs by tape measure or survey
Responsibility: Project Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor Superintendent

Acceptance Criteria: Where new pavement abuts an existing pavement, the existing pavement shall be removed in steps to achieve an offset from layer to layer of not less than 150mm. Depth of step to be cut to the full depth of each indiviual layer.
Acceptance Criteria: Approval to place asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an ordinary of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement.
Record of Conformity: Inspection and Test Plan
Responsibility: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
Acceptance Criteria: Prior to commencing cold weather placement of asphalt, the Contractor shall submit a job specific cold weather placement management plan to the Superintendent for review.
Record of Conformity: Inspection and Test Plan
Responsibility: Project Engineer/ Asphalt Project Manager or Engineer
Acceptance Criteria: Check correct mix design as per pavement design has been delivered prior to laying mix.
Inspection / Test Method: Visual Inspection & Delivery Docket
Record of Conformity: Delivery docket Completed ITP
Acceptance Criteria: Traffic not to be placed on asphalt placed until Fulton Hogan agree the surface temperature is less than the required mix temp. (SMA 40°C) to receive traffic.
Record of Conformity: Inspection and Test Plan ITP Signed Thermometer / gauage

Acceptance Criteria: 407.21 - DGA as per 407.22 405.08 - RGG - not less than 3 passes with steel wheeled roller. 3 passes to be made within time to compaction cessation substrate (pavement) temperature is between 7° and 10°C.
Inspection / Test Method: Material Sampling & testing
Record of Conformity: Visual Inspection/ Compaction test results Visual Inspection/ Visual Inspection/ Field Report/
Responsibility: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor Superintendent
Frequency: Per 4,000m2 at completion of work
Acceptance Criteria: 407.293 Surface Level Tolerances for Sub-base and Pavement Courses
Reference Documents: VicRoads Sec 407.293 Surface Level Tolerances for Sub-base and Pavement Courses
Inspection / Test Method: Document Review/ Site Inspection
Record of Conformity: Survey Conformance Report
Responsibility: Site Engineer/ Surveyor / Survey Manager
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan's Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
Is the relevant RFI attached to the Lot?
Is the relevant NCR attached to the Lot?
Are any relevant Mails/ Transmittals attached to the Lot?
